> Sometimes there are corporate standards to be followed. Sometimes the 
> humble corporate programmers get mandates from above, backed up by 
> promises of "consequences" if any of the shiny new rules are broken. Sad 
> but true. I've worked in some places where it's dangerous to be caught 
> thinking.
> 
> assertEquals(myEmployer, "nice people");

And sometimes programmers do silly things. I just wanted to know which 
it was. Sometimes the mere act of asking such a question makes the 
programmer think, "Wow, that /is/ silly."
